intro: Biscutella brevicalcarata, commonly known as the short-spurred biscuitroot, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many flowering plants with small, four-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 10–30 centimeters, featuring hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are usually pale yellow or white, with four petals that are slightly curved at the tips. Biscutella brevicalcarata is adapted to harsh, alpine environments and is often found in rocky or gravelly soils.
